meanings.definition: A rapid succession of sharp, cracking sounds.
meanings.sent1: The ratatats of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent2: I heard the ratatats of the drumsticks during the music performance.
meanings.sent3: The ratatats of the popcorn popping in the microwave made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The ratatats of the hail hitting the roof sounded like tiny drums.
meanings.sent5: The ratatats of the typewriter keys created a rhythmic melody in the office.

meanings.definition: To make a rapid succession of sharp, cracking sounds.
meanings.sent1: The kids love to ratatats on bubble wrap to hear the popping sounds.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally stepped on a twig, causing it to ratatats loudly.
meanings.sent3: The chef began to ratatats as he chopped the vegetables for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks ratatats in the distance signaled the start of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The old door ratatats every time it is opened, adding character to the house.
